## 1. Summary
The discussion primarily focused on Hyperfy platform development, deployment, and technical features. Key topics included:

Deployment methods for Hyperfy worlds, with detailed instructions from Ashxn on setting up Docker Compose with Coolify, including environment variables configuration and domain setup. HypPrivakos mentioned that exporting features were recently released on hyperworld.host.

Technical rendering advice was shared, with Ashxn warning against using transmission effects on transparent materials due to performance issues on mobile/VR as it "renders the entire screen multiple times" and consumes excessive CPU/GPU resources.

Several feature requests and improvements were discussed, including a request from Alephic for skybox vertical following functionality for space settings, which Ashxn agreed to implement. Vox suggested adding code/.hyp functionality to the Scene field in World settings, which Ashxn confirmed was already planned as "environment" apps locked at 0,0,0 coordinates.

Community members shared creative applications, including 0mka's portal pack with emissive edges and scaling features, and discussions about digital twins for fish, cows, and trees that could interact with real-world counterparts.

# Discord Chat Analysis for "‚ö°‚îÇgeneral"

## 1. Summary:
The chat primarily revolves around Hyperfy platform features and potential improvements. Ashxn confirmed that LiveKit is currently supported for spatial voice chat, though push-to-talk and recording features aren't implemented yet. User management was identified as an urgent need, with Ashxn suggesting two key features for formal events: a voice chat permission switch and admin controls (mute, kick, ban). Portal functionality was discussed, with confirmation that users can create portals between maps. Community members also proposed features like object grouping in building mode and making hyperlinks clickable in visitor mode. The conversation indicates ongoing development with focus on improving user management and building tools.

## 2. FAQ:
Q: Do you have any suggestions or solutions if we want to have a meeting in the Hyperfy-based metaverse? (asked by ovo) A: Right now it's more suitable for super casual events. For formal events, you would need: 1. a voice chat permission switch for "everyone" or "just admins" 2. mute, kick, ban buttons if you are an admin (answered by Ashxn)
Q: Is there anyway to add a portal in hyperfy which able to send user to another map ex: from open map > enter a meeting room map? (asked by Cayden0207) A: Yes! Grab the portal in the play world someone put there (answered by Ashxn)
Q: Is playworlds locked? (asked by 0mka) A: My bad, was testing something earlier. Unlocked it (answered by Ashxn)

# Discord Chat Analysis for üßä‚îÇ3d-design

## 1. Summary
The conversation primarily focused on techniques for creating realistic lighting effects in 3D scenes. The main technical discussion centered around making sunlight pass through glass objects by manipulating shadow properties. Users discussed setting castShadow and receiveShadow to false on glass objects to allow light to penetrate, with the note that receiveShadow might still be useful in some cases. This technique was highlighted as particularly valuable for indoor scenes with skylights, cathedrals with stained glass, and creating god ray effects. Additional techniques mentioned included using transparent cones with fading to fake light rays. The chat briefly touched on UVscrolling as a zero-overhead technique for creating effects, and there was a mention of GaussianSplats3D, with a suggestion that Hyperfy could support .splat files.

## 2. FAQ
Q: How to get the sun to shine through glass? (asked by Gert-Jan Akerboom) A: Set castShadow and receiveShadow to false on the glass, though in some cases you might want receiveShadow to still be true. (answered by Ashxn)
Q: Can you really get sun to shine through glass this way? (asked by untitled, xyz) A: Yes, if you have a primarily indoor scene, you can set your roof to let light in. (answered by Ashxn)

## 3. Help Interactions
Helper: Ashxn | Helpee: Gert-Jan Akerboom | Context: Needed to know how to make sunlight pass through glass | Resolution: Advised to set castShadow and receiveShadow to false on glass objects
Helper: Ashxn | Helpee: untitled, xyz | Context: Discussing cathedral design with stained glass and god rays | Resolution: Suggested using a transparent cone with fading to fake light rays
